definition: Dimensional analysis of ecosystems - 3D networks with 4D succession dynamics, food webs as directed graphs, niches as geometric positions in resource space
geometric_view: Ecosystems as 3D networks with 4D succession dynamics; food webs as directed graphs; niches as geometric positions in resource space

food_webs.principle: Directed graphs (2D networks) showing energy flow between species

niches.principle: Geometric positions in multidimensional resource space
niches.fundamental_niche: All conditions where species could survive
niches.realized_niche: Actual conditions where species exists (competition reduces)
niches.competition: Niche overlap → competitive exclusion or coexistence
niches.geometric_view: Each species occupies unique region of environmental hyperspace

succession.principle: 4D process of ecosystem development through time
succession.primary: Colonization of bare substrate (new volcanic island)
succession.trajectory: Low diversity → high diversity → stable equilibrium
succession.geometric_essence: 4D path through ecosystem state space toward attractor

biodiversity.geometry: High-dimensional network with many nodes and connections

ecosystem_services.supporting: Nutrient cycling, soil formation, primary production
ecosystem_services.geometric_basis: Emergent properties of complex 3D living system

coevolution.principle: Species evolving together through 4D coupled dynamics

competition.example: Two species competing for same food

parasitism.strategy: Harm host slightly but not kill

predator_prey.dynamics: Oscillations in predator and prey numbers

metapopulations.geometry: Network of habitat patches in 2D space

observables: Food web structure and energy flow (who eats whom)
Nutrient cycling patterns (N, P, C cycles)
controls: Human impacts (habitat loss, pollution, climate change)

2D_networks.evidence: Network topology determines ecosystem stability and function

3D_ecosystems.evidence: Ecosystems occupy 3D space and integrate all trophic levels

4D_succession.evidence: Ecological communities change predictably through 4D time

reduction_examples.raw: Complex food web with 50 species and hundreds of feeding links

reduction.evidence: Food web as directed graph - 2D network structure determines energy flow

reduction_examples.raw: Forest recovering over 100 years after fire

reduction.evidence: Ecological succession as 4D trajectory through community state space

reduction_examples.raw: Species occupying specific combination of temperature, moisture, and food resources

reduction.evidence: Ecological niche as geometric region in multidimensional resource space

integration_with_cfo.principle: Ecosystems = 2D networks + 3D spatial integration + 4D temporal succession
integration_with_cfo.mechanism: Species interactions form network topology → ecosystem properties emerge
integration_with_cfo.coherence: Healthy ecosystems maintain high coherence through functional diversity
integration_with_cfo.sacred: Nature's networks reflect divine interconnection of all life
